If they were not able to install the software via the meeting, they would refund the cost. There is NO WAY I am going to allow them access to my laptop to UNINSTALL the copy we finally were able to successfully install! With the issues with the software, and the ridiculousness of their request (involving uninstalling the second copy purchased, then trying to install the first copy purchased), there is no way I will give them access to my computer! They have proof of two purchases of the exact same software and the email requests for assistance in which they brushed us off. If a ZOOM meeting was required, they should have offered that back in February when the problem began.Each consumer will have to make a personal decision on whether or not to purchase from this company. However, for us, the purchase turned out to be either faulty software (from the first purchase), incorrect software (perhaps they gave us the single use instead of multiple device use), false advertising (saying it was for multiple devices when in fact it was only good for one device) or just a scam. We will NOT purchase from this company again and will be doing everything we can to make others aware of the problems with this company.
